algorithm_technique: Single pass through the linked list to identify critical points and calculate distances.
problem_summary_simple: Find the min and max distance between critical points (local max/min) in a linked list.
problem_summary_technical: Traverse the linked list, identify local extrema (critical points), and track the first, last, and minimum distances between them.
key_insights: A critical point requires a node to have both a previous and a next node to compare values.
The solution involves a single pass through the linked list, keeping track of the index of the previous node and the most recently found critical point.
Edge cases include lists with fewer than two critical points, where the result should be [-1, -1].
